hints.title: KL-Convergence for Mean-Field Euclidean Gas (CORRECTED)
hints.content:
3085: :label: thm-corrected-kl-convergence
3086: 
3087: If the kinetic dominance condition holds:
3088: 
3089: $$
3090: \sigma^2 \gamma \kappa_{\text{conf}} > C_0 \max\left(\frac{\lambda}{M_\infty}, \bar{\kappa}\right)
3091: $$
3092: 
3093: then the mean-field Euclidean Gas converges exponentially to its QSD:
3094: 
3095: $$
3096: D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_t \| \rho_\infty) \le e^{-\alpha_{\text{net}} t} D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_0 \| \rho_\infty) + \frac{B_{\text{jump}}}{\alpha_{\text{net}}} (1 - e^{-\alpha_{\text{net}} t})
3097: $$
3098: 
3099: where $\alpha_{\text{net}} = \alpha_{\text{kin}} - A_{\text{jump}} > 0$.
